From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Catalan

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central) [pus.tuˈla]
  • IPA(key): (Balearic) [pos.tuˈla]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [pos.tuˈlaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)

Verb

[edit]

postular (first-person singular present postulo, first-person singular preterite postulí, past participle postulat)

  1. to apply (for)
  2. to postulate

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of postular (first conjugation)

gerund postulant

singular postulat postulada
plural postulats postulades

Ido

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin postulāre. Also found in the older usages of English postulate and French postuler.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /postuˈlar/

Verb

[edit]

postular (present postulas, past postulis, future postulos, conditional postulus, imperative postulez)

  1. (transitive) to demand, exact, require

Conjugation

[edit]
Conjugation of postular
present past future
infinitive postular postulir postulor
tense postulas postulis postulos
conditional postulus — —
imperative postulez — —
adjective active participle postulanta postulinta postulonta
adverbial active participle postulante postulinte postulonte
nominal
active participle 		singular postulanto postulinto postulonto
plural postulanti postulinti postulonti
adjective passive participle postulata postulita postulota
adverbial passive participle postulate postulite postulote
nominal
passive participle 		singular postulato postulito postuloto
plural postulati postuliti postuloti

Derived terms

[edit]
  • postulo (“demand, requirement, exigency”)
  • postulajo (“what is demanded, claimed”)
  • postulema (“exacting”)

See also

[edit]
  • demandar

References

[edit]
  • Progreso II (in Ido), 1909–1910, page 78, 167
  • Progreso III (in Ido), 1910–1911, page 224

Portuguese

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /pos.tuˈla(ʁ)/ [pos.tuˈla(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /pos.tuˈla(ʁ)/ [pos.tuˈla(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /pos.tuˈla(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /poʃ.tuˈla(ʁ)/ [poʃ.tuˈla(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /pos.tuˈla(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /puʃ.tuˈlaɾ/
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /puʃ.tuˈlaɾ/
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /puʃ.tuˈla.ɾi/

  • Hyphenation: pos‧tu‧lar

Verb

[edit]

postular (first-person singular present postulo, first-person singular preterite postulei, past participle postulado)

  1. to postulate

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin postulāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /postuˈlaɾ/ [pos.t̪uˈlaɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: pos‧tu‧lar

Verb

[edit]

postular (first-person singular present postulo, first-person singular preterite postulé, past participle postulado)

  1. to nominate
  2. (reflexive) to apply (for example to a job)
    Se postuló para un trabajo.
    He applied for a job.
  3. to postulate

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of postular (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)

gerund postulando

plural postulados postuladas

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
